intro: Lippia queretarensis, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
